31 namespace Random {
32 
34 template<typename D, size_t N, typename UnaryPredicate>
35 void GetRandomVectors(size_t numSamples,
36  const std::array<Vector<D, 2>, N>& indexRanges,
37  std::vector<Vector<D, N>>& outVec,
38  UnaryPredicate predicate)
39 {
40  outVec.resize(numSamples);
41  GetRandomVectors(numSamples, indexRanges, outVec.data(), predicate);
42 }
43 
44 template<typename D, size_t N, typename UnaryPredicate>
45 void GetRandomVectors(size_t numSamples,
46  const std::array<Vector<D, 2>, N>& indexRanges,
47  Vector<D, N>* outData,
48  UnaryPredicate predicate)
49 {
50  // Random values between [0.0, 1.0]
51  std::uniform_real_distribution<D> randomRange(0.0, 1.0);
52  static std::default_random_engine generator;
53 
54  // Get scale and shift from desired ranges
55  std::array<Vector<D, 2>, N> scaleShift;
56  for (size_t i = 0; i < N; i++) {
57  scaleShift[i][0] = indexRanges[i][1] - indexRanges[i][0];
58  scaleShift[i][1] = indexRanges[i][0];
59  }
60 
61  // Generate vectors based on number of input samples and index ranges
62  for (size_t i = 0; i < numSamples; i++) {
63  // Randomize direction
64  for (size_t j = 0; j < N; j++) {
65  D scale = scaleShift[j][0];
66  D shift = scaleShift[j][1];
67  outData[i][j] = randomRange(generator) * scale + shift;
68  }
69 
70  // Randomize range
71  outData[i].normalize();
72  outData[i] *= randomRange(generator);
73 
74  // Use predicate to scale value
75  outData[i] *= predicate(i, numSamples);
76  }
77 }
78 
80 }
81 } // End namespaces
82 
83 #endif
